articles.title: Customizing multiturn AI agents with reinforcement learning
articles.summary: Leveraging existing environment simulators and reward functions based on verifiable ground truth boosts task success rate, even with small models and small training datasets.
articles.author: Shreyas Subramanian

articles.title: Fine-tuning vision-language models on memory-constrained devices
articles.summary: A new hybrid optimization approach allows edge devices to fine-tune vision-language models using only forward passes, achieving up to 7% higher accuracy than existing techniques.
articles.author: Rupak Vignesh Swaminathan

articles.title: The unseen work of building reliable AI agents
articles.summary: "Reinforcement learning gyms" train agents on the many low-level tasks that they must chain together to execute customer requests.
articles.author: Jason Laster

articles.title: The 10 most viewed publications of 2025
articles.summary: From foundation model safety frameworks and formal verification at cloud scale to advanced robotics and multimodal AI reasoning, these are the most viewed publications from Amazon scientists and collaborators in 2025.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: The 10 most viewed blog posts of 2025
articles.summary: From quantum computing breakthroughs and foundation models for robotics to the evolution of Amazon Aurora and advances in agentic AI, these are the posts that captured readers' attention in 2025.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Dialogue Boost: How Amazon is using AI to enhance TV and movie dialogue
articles.summary: New audio-processing technology is making entertainment more accessible for millions of viewers.
articles.author: Yuzhou Liu

articles.title: Amazon Nova Forge: "Open training” paradigm that empowers everyone to build their own frontier AI
articles.summary: New service lets customers mix their own data with the data used to train Amazon Nova at each major stage of model development, enabling deep domain understanding while preventing "catastrophic forgetting".
articles.author: Rohit Prasad

articles.title: AutoGluon assistant: Zero-code AutoML through multiagent collaboration
articles.summary: A multiagent architecture separates data perception, tool knowledge, execution history, and code generation, enabling ML automation that works with messy, real-world inputs.
articles.author: Haoyang Fang

articles.title: AI-native 6G: From networks to intelligence fabrics
articles.summary: “Network language models” will coordinate complex interactions among intelligent components, computational infrastructure, access points, data centers, and more.
articles.author: Imen Grida Ben Yahya

articles.title: Using LLMs to improve Amazon product listings
articles.summary: Large language models are increasing the accuracy, reliability, and consistency of the product catalogue at scale.
articles.author: Abhishek Agrawal

articles.title: The overthinking problem in AI
articles.summary: Reasoning models can generate seven to 10 times as many tokens as necessary on simple tasks, creating unsustainable costs at scale. Amazon's vision for metacognitive AI could fundamentally shift how models allocate computational resources.
articles.author: Firat Elbey

articles.title: 63 Amazon Research Award recipients announced
articles.summary: Awardees, who represent 41 universities in 8 countries, have access to Amazon public datasets, along with AWS AI/ML services and tools.
articles.author: Amazon Research Awards team

articles.title: How Amazon uses AI agents to anticipate and counter cyber threats
articles.summary: Amazon's competitive-agent architecture creates a continuous improvement cycle that develops security protections at machine speed, reducing what typically takes weeks down to hours.
articles.author: Daniel Weiss

articles.title: Making fairness in LLMs observable, quantifiable, and governable
articles.summary: A new evaluation pipeline called FiSCo uncovers hidden biases and offers an assessment framework that evolves alongside language models.
articles.author: Weijie Xu

articles.title: Amazon launches private AI bug bounty to strengthen Nova models
articles.summary: Partnering with professional security researchers and the academic community to build safer, more robust AI.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: A new view of supply chain emissions
articles.summary: A new approach to reducing carbon emissions reveals previously hidden emission “hotspots” within value chains, helping organizations make more detailed and dynamic decisions about their future carbon footprints.
articles.author: Nina Domingo

articles.title: Amazon announces the 2026 Amazon Nova AI Challenge: Trusted Software Agents track
articles.summary: Challenge pushes teams to demonstrate measurable gains in secure-coding performance while building AI agents that advance real-world utility and reliability at scale.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Amazon launches $68 million AI PhD Fellowship program
articles.summary: Initiative will fund over 100 doctoral students researching machine learning, computer vision, and natural-language processing at nine universities.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Introducing Chronos-2: From univariate to universal forecasting
articles.summary: In-context learning enables a model that can solve forecasting tasks with an arbitrary number of dimensions in a zero-shot manner.
articles.author: Abdul Fatir Ansari

articles.title: Demystifying AI agents
articles.summary: Amazon vice president and distinguished engineer Marc Brooker explains how agentic systems work under the hood — and how AWS’s new AgentCore framework implements their essential components.
articles.author: Marc Brooker

articles.title: Amazon and Carnegie Mellon University launch strategic AI Innovation Hub
articles.summary: The collaboration will advance research in generative AI, robotics, natural language processing and cloud computing while fostering innovation in foundational and emerging technologies.

articles.title: Why AI for good depends on good data
articles.summary: New technologies are helping vulnerable communities produce maps that integrate topographical, infrastructural, seasonal, and real-time data — an essential tool for many humanitarian endeavors.
articles.author: Werner Vogels

articles.title: Novel “Kaputt” dataset sets new benchmark for large-scale visual defect detection
articles.summary: A new dataset with over 238,000 images challenges and advances the state of the art in visual defect detection for complex retail applications.
articles.author: Sebastian Hoefer

articles.title: Amazon Research Awards issues fall 2025 call for proposals
articles.summary: The submission opens October 1 and closes on November 12, 2025

articles.title: Science in the age of foundation models
articles.summary: To transform scientific domains, foundation models will require physical-constraint satisfaction, uncertainty quantification, and specialized forecasting techniques that overcome data scarcity while maintaining scientific rigor.
articles.author: Danielle Maddix Robinson

articles.title: Scientific frontiers of agentic AI
articles.summary: The language AI agents might speak, sharing context without compromising privacy, modeling agentic negotiations, and understanding users’ commonsense policies are some of the open scientific questions that researchers in agentic AI will need to grapple with.
articles.author: Michael Kearns

articles.title: Simplifying book discovery with ML-powered visual autocomplete suggestions
articles.summary: Audible's ML algorithms connect users directly to relevant titles, reducing the number of purchase steps for millions of daily users.
articles.author: Mao Sheng Liu

articles.title: Revolutionizing warehouse automation with scientific simulation
articles.summary: With a novel parallel-computing architecture, a CAD-to-USD pipeline, and the use of OpenUSD as ground truth, a new simulator can explore hundreds of sensor configurations in the time it takes to test just a few physical setups.
articles.author: Deniz Akyildiz

articles.title: A decade of database innovation: The Amazon Aurora story
articles.summary: From reimagining storage to serverless computing, Aurora continues to push the boundaries of what's possible in database technology.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Amazon builds first foundation model for multirobot coordination
articles.summary: Trained on millions of hours of data from Amazon fulfillment centers and sortation centers, Amazon’s new DeepFleet models predict future traffic patterns for fleets of mobile robots.
articles.author: Joey Durham

articles.title: A better path to pruning large language models
articles.summary: A new philosophy for developing LLM architectures reduces energy requirements, speeds up runtime, and preserves pretrained-model performance.
articles.author: Kai Zhen

articles.title: Three challenges in machine-based reasoning
articles.summary: Translating from natural to structured language, defining truth, and definitive reasoning remain topics of central concern in automated reasoning, but Amazon Web Services’ new Automated Reasoning checks help address all of them.
articles.author: Byron Cook

articles.title: Multiagent AI for generating chain-of-thought training data
articles.summary: Using ensembles of agents to generate and refine interactions annotated with chains of thought improves performance on a battery of benchmarks by an average of 29%.
articles.author: Charith Peris

articles.title: Measuring the effectiveness of software development tools and practices
articles.summary: New cost-to-serve-software metric that accounts for the full software development lifecycle helps determine which software development innovations provide quantifiable value.
articles.author: Willie deButts

articles.title: Pushing the boundaries of secure AI: Winners of the Amazon Nova AI Challenge
articles.summary: University teams battle to harden and hack AI coding assistants in head-to-head tournament
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Mitra: Mixed synthetic priors for enhancing tabular foundation models
articles.summary: Generating diverse synthetic prior distributions leads to a tabular foundation model that outperforms task-specific baselines.
articles.author: Xiyuan Zhang

articles.title: Pruning network nodes on the fly to improve LLM efficiency
articles.summary: Language models inspired by specialized processing regions in the brain offer significant time and cost savings.
articles.author: Jing Liu

articles.title: FalseReject: Reducing overcautiousness in LLMs through reasoning-aware safety evaluation
articles.summary: Novel graph-based, adversarial, agentic method for generating training examples helps identify — and mitigate — "overrefusal".
articles.author: Zhehao Zhang

articles.title: Unsupervised, generalizable method for doing anomaly detection
articles.summary: An ensemble of models, weighted according to their reluctance to flag anomalies, outperforms its predecessors.
articles.author: Abishek Sankararaman

articles.title: Using generative AI to do multimodal information retrieval
articles.summary: With large datasets, directly generating data ID codes from query embeddings is much more efficient than performing pairwise comparisons between queries and candidate responses.
articles.author: Sungyeon Kim

articles.title: Finalist teams advance in the Amazon Nova AI Challenge: Trusted AI Track
articles.summary: Top eight university teams move on to head-to-head finals focused on AI security for code generation.
articles.author: Staff writer

articles.title: Scaling up image segmentation across data and tasks
articles.summary: Novel architecture that fuses learnable queries and conditional queries improves a segmentation model’s ability to transfer across tasks.
articles.author: Pei Wang

articles.title: 75 Amazon Research Award recipients announced
articles.summary: Awardees, who represent 46 universities in 10 countries, have access to Amazon public datasets, along with AWS AI/ML services and tools.
articles.author: Amazon Research Awards team

articles.title: Independent evaluations demonstrate Nova Premier’s safety
articles.summary: In both black-box stress testing and red-team exercises, Nova Premier comes out on top.
articles.author: Rahul Gupta

articles.title: A first-of-its-kind experiment to measure the impact of out-of-home advertising
articles.summary: By combining surveys with ads targeted to metro and commuter rail lines, Amazon researchers identify the fraction of residents of different neighborhoods exposed to the ads and measure ad effectiveness.
articles.author: Egor Abramov

articles.title: The path to better plastics: Our progress and partnerships
articles.summary: How Amazon is helping transform plastics through innovation in materials, recycling technology, sortation, and more.
articles.author: Alan Jacobsen

articles.title: How Amazon’s Vulcan robots use touch to plan and execute motions
articles.summary: Unique end-of-arm tools with three-dimensional force sensors and innovative control algorithms enable robotic arms to “pick” items from and “stow” items in fabric storage pods.
articles.author: Larry Hardesty

articles.title: A better training method for reinforcement learning with human feedback
articles.summary: Contrasting training pairs with large reward differences mitigate spurious correlations and improve performance of direct-alignment algorithms by as much as 20%–40%.
articles.author: Sailik Sengupta

articles.title: Automating hallucination detection with chain-of-thought reasoning
articles.summary: Novel three-pronged approach combines claim-level evaluations, chain-of-thought reasoning, and classification of hallucination error types.
articles.author: Erica Salinas

articles.title: An AI agent for data science: Amazon Q Developer in SageMaker Canvas
articles.summary: New tool lets customers build, train, and deploy machine learning models using only natural language.
articles.author: Yaroslav Kharkov
